HomePage.title: NextDevTpl
HomePage.subtitle: Production-Ready Next.js SaaS Template
HomePage.description: Ship your SaaS product faster with a production-ready full-stack template.

Hero.subtitle: Build and ship faster with production-ready infrastructure. Authentication, payments, and beautiful UI components out of the box.

Features.label: Core Features
Features.title: Everything You Need to Launch
Features.subtitle: Every essential SaaS feature, pre-built and production-ready, so you can focus on what makes your product unique.

ai.title: Auth & Security
ai.description: Better Auth with email/password, Google and GitHub OAuth, email verification, and role-based access control out of the box.

multiSource.title: Payment & Subscription
multiSource.description: Creem integration for subscriptions and one-time purchases. Four plan tiers with automatic billing cycle management.

outline.title: Credits System
outline.description: Double-entry bookkeeping with FIFO batch expiration. Grant, consume, and track credits with full transaction history.

export.title: Async Processing
export.description: Inngest-powered background jobs that bypass serverless timeouts. Built-in task queue with status polling and progress tracking.

batch.title: Internationalization
batch.description: Full i18n support via next-intl with locale-prefixed routes. Ship in multiple languages from day one.

multilingual.title: Admin Dashboard
multilingual.description: Built-in admin panel for user management, support tickets, and platform statistics. Role-based access with admin-only routes.

HowItWorks.label: How It Works
HowItWorks.title: From Zero to Production in Three Steps
HowItWorks.subtitle: Get your SaaS up and running in minutes, not months.

upload.title: Clone & Configure
upload.description: Clone the repository, install dependencies with pnpm, and set your environment variables. Database, auth, and payments are ready to connect.

generate.title: Customize & Build
generate.description: Replace the example features with your own business logic. The modular architecture keeps everything organized by feature domain.

export.title: Deploy & Launch
export.description: Deploy to Vercel, your own server, or any Node.js host. Push your Drizzle schema, configure webhooks, and go live.

completion.title: That's it!
completion.description: Your SaaS is live. Focus on growing your product and acquiring customers.

UseCases.label: Use Cases
UseCases.title: Build Any SaaS Product
UseCases.subtitle: NextDevTpl provides the foundation for a wide range of SaaS applications.

students.title: AI Products
students.subtitle: AI-Powered Applications
students.description: Build AI wrappers, content generators, or intelligent assistants. The credits system and async processing handle LLM calls and usage metering out of the box.

professionals.title: Productivity Tools
professionals.subtitle: Workflow & Collaboration
professionals.description: Create project management, note-taking, or team collaboration tools. Auth, roles, and subscription tiers are already wired up.

language.title: Creator Platforms
language.subtitle: Content & Community
language.description: Launch platforms for creators, educators, or communities. Payment processing, user dashboards, and file storage are ready to use.

knowledge.title: Internal Tools
knowledge.subtitle: Business Operations
knowledge.description: Build internal dashboards, admin panels, or data management tools. The admin module and role-based access provide a solid starting point.

Testimonials.label: Testimonials
Testimonials.title: What Developers Say
Testimonials.subtitle: Developers around the world are using NextDevTpl to ship their SaaS products faster.

items.content: I went from idea to paying customers in under a week. The auth, payments, and credits system saved me at least a month of development time.
items.author: Sarah Lin

items.content: The Inngest integration for background jobs is a game-changer. I no longer worry about serverless timeouts when processing large tasks for my users.
items.author: Michael Zhang

items.content: Having i18n baked in from the start made expanding to international markets seamless. We launched in English and Chinese simultaneously.
items.author: Emily Chen

items.content: The credits system with double-entry bookkeeping is incredibly well-designed. It took me five minutes to wire up usage metering for my API product.
items.author: David Wang

items.content: The modular feature architecture is exactly what I needed. Each domain is self-contained, so onboarding new developers to the codebase is effortless.
items.author: Lisa Li

items.content: I've tried dozens of SaaS boilerplates. This one stands out because it doesn't cut corners — the admin panel, support tickets, and subscription management all work end-to-end.
items.author: Kevin Zhao

FAQ.label: FAQ
FAQ.title: Questions You Might Have
FAQ.subtitle: Common questions and answers about NextDevTpl.

items.question: What is NextDevTpl?
items.answer: NextDevTpl is a production-ready Next.js SaaS starter template. It includes authentication, payment processing, a credits system, background job processing, internationalization, an admin dashboard, and more — everything you need to launch a SaaS product quickly.

items.question: What tech stack does it use?
items.answer: Next.js 15 (App Router), React 19, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS 4, Shadcn/UI, Drizzle ORM with PostgreSQL, Better Auth for authentication, Creem for payments, Inngest for async processing, next-intl for i18n, and Biome for linting and formatting.

items.question: How is the credits system designed?
items.answer: The credits system uses double-entry bookkeeping with FIFO batch expiration. Every credit movement creates a transaction with debit and credit accounts. Credits can be granted via subscriptions, purchases, or admin actions, and consumed by any feature you build.

items.question: Can I customize the subscription plans?
items.answer: Absolutely. The subscription plan configuration is centralized in a single config file. You can adjust plan names, pricing, credit allocations, feature limits, and billing cycles to match your product's needs.

items.question: Does it support background processing?
items.answer: Yes. Inngest handles all background jobs, solving the serverless timeout problem. Tasks run asynchronously with status polling and progress tracking built in. You can easily add your own Inngest functions for any long-running work.

items.question: Is it ready for production?
items.answer: Yes. The template includes rate limiting, error monitoring (Sentry), structured logging (Pino + Axiom), secure file storage (Cloudflare R2), and graceful degradation for optional services. It's designed to run on a VPS or any Node.js hosting platform.
